properties.notes: Currently the location of established housing but the land has been identified for potential redevelopment. Demolition of the existing dwellings would be required in order to a redevelopment project. Not available at the current time and future availability depends on the requirements of the registered provider, although it is understood future options are being considered.

properties.ownership: not owned by a public authority
properties.notes: Brownfield site within existing urban area, previously occupied by sheltered housing scheme but site now vacant following clearance. Offers opportunity for urban infill scheme. An application for construction of 8 new dwellings is pending consideration (19/02032/FUL).

properties.ownership: not owned by a public authority
properties.notes: Vacant site in an existing residential area, previously occupied by a housing scheme but now cleared. A full application for residential development has now been permitted for 12 homes for affordable rent and 10 for shared ownership (17/04048/FUL). Development is yet to commence but completion is expected within the next 5 years.

properties.ownership: not owned by a public authority
properties.notes: Site currently being occupied by domestic garages but is understood to be available for redevelopment following clearance. A proposal for the construction of 9 affordable dwellings following demolition of 6 existing dwellings, was permitted March 2019 (18/03787/FUL). This scheme covers two parcels of land (9502 and 9105) and is yet to commence given the recent approval. A previous application across three parcels of land (9095, 9096, 9503) for 15 affordable dwellings, after demolition of existing homes, was withdrawn July 2018 (18/00887/FUL). Capacity recorded against site 9503.

properties.ownership: not owned by a public authority
properties.notes: Site currently being occupied by domestic garages but is understood to be available for redevelopment following clearance. A previous application across three parcels of land (9095, 9096, 9503) for 15 affordable dwellings, after demolition of existing homes, was withdrawn July 2018 (18/00887/FUL). A revised proposal, since permitted, excluded this particular parcel. This site may provide further potential in the longer-term depending on future requirements.

properties.ownership: owned by a public authority
properties.notes: Former library located in the town centre that is now available following relocation of the facility. This could provide an opportunity for residential development through conversion. A proposal for a change of use of an existing library to 4 dwellings, including demolition, extensions and alterations, is pending consideration (19/00078/FUL). If permitted, the deliverability of the site will be reappraised.

properties.site-address: Land West of Station Road, Hexham
properties.ownership: not owned by a public authority
properties.notes: Brownfield site on edge of town centre currently occupied by existing businesses, with a number of buildings in situ.  Demolition and site clearance would be required prior to redevelopment. Identified as an allocation in the draft Local Plan (submitted May 2019) and also in the Hexham Neighbourhood Plan.

properties.ownership: not owned by a public authority
properties.notes: Land towards the edge of the settlement that is currently utilised for storage purposes. Not immediately available but the sit has been proposed for redevelopment. An outline application for up to 9 dwellings has been refused (17/03660/OUT). However, this does not prevent a suitable scheme coming forward in the future following a revised proposal being deemed appropriate. Identified as an allocation in the draft Local Plan (submitted May 2019).

properties.site-address: Land to West of East Farm, Pegswood
properties.ownership: not owned by a public authority
properties.notes: Currently vacant land following clearance that should be viewed as part of wider proposal (sites 3017, 9114 and 9115).  A full application is now pending for conversion of the Grade II listed farm buildings to 2 dwellings, change of use of former shop into cafe,  refurbishment of an existing flat and 28 additional dwellings (18/00168/FUL). This proposal relates to SHLAA sites 3017, 9114 and 9115. A previous outline application for approximately 17 dwellings was disposed without determination (15/04203/OUT). Capacity is recorded against the main site (3017). If permitted, the deliverability of the site will be reappraised.

properties.site-address: Land to East of East Farm, Pegswood
properties.ownership: not owned by a public authority
properties.notes: Land that is currently part vacant and part occupied by existing buildings but should be viewed as part of wider proposal (sites 3017, 9114 and 9115). A full application is now pending for conversion of the Grade II listed farm buildings to 2 dwellings, change of use of former shop into cafe,  refurbishment of an existing flat and 28 additional dwellings (18/00168/FUL). This proposal relates to SHLAA sites 3017, 9114 and 9115. A previous outline application for approximately 17 dwellings was disposed without determination (15/04203/OUT). Capacity is recorded against the main site (3017). If permitted, the deliverability of the site will be reappraised.

properties.ownership: not owned by a public authority
properties.notes: Offices within town centre offering opportunity for redevelopment through conversion, with apartment scheme being suitable given location. Planning permission is now in place for conversion on an existing first and second floors into 6 one- and two-bed flats (17/04396/FUL).

properties.ownership: not owned by a public authority
properties.notes: This land is part occupied by an existing cottage, which will require clearance, with the remainder being vacant. Highlighted for potential redevelopment along with adjacent land (9122). In September 2019, permission was granted for replacement of the existing cottage and haulage garage with 2 dormer bungalows and 3 town houses (19/01224/FUL). A proposal for redevelopment for a block of 8 apartments and 3 town houses was withdrawn (18/02546/FUL). Previous proposal for replacement of existing cottage and haulage garage with seven town houses was refused (17/04396/FUL).

properties.ownership: not owned by a public authority
properties.notes: An existing building is in situ, previously in use as a garage, but now disused. Highlighted for potential redevelopment along with adjacent land (9121). In September 2019, permission was granted for replacement of existing cottage and haulage garage with 2 dormer bungalows and 3 town houses (19/01224/FUL). A proposal for redevelopment for a block of 8 apartments and 3 town houses was withdrawn (18/02546/FUL). Previous proposal for replacement of existing cottage and haulage garage with seven town houses was refused (17/04396/FUL).

properties.ownership: not owned by a public authority
properties.notes: Brownfield land within Hexham that consists of a warehouse, other associated buildings and hardstanding. Redevelopment could potentially be progressed a part of a group of adjacent sites (2040, 3628 and 9136). Not immediately available but could provide potential in the longer-term. Along with adjacent land, the site is identified as an allocation in the draft Local Plan (submitted May 2019) and also in the Hexham Neighbourhood Plan (Site H 1-5).

properties.ownership: not owned by a public authority
properties.notes: Currently occupied by a range of established buildings and operational businesses. Likely to offer a longer-term option for conversion to residential uses following clearance. The site is identified as an allocation in the draft Local Plan (submitted May 2019) and also in the Hexham Neighbourhood Plan (Site H 1-7).

properties.site-address: Graves Yard behind Army Reserve Centre, Hexham
properties.ownership: not owned by a public authority
properties.notes: Edge of town centre site that is  occupied by a range of buildings and storage facilities relating to operational businesses. Clearance of site would be required prior to redevelopment. The site is identified as an allocation in the draft Local Plan (submitted May 2019) and also in the Hexham Neighbourhood Plan (Site H 1-8).

properties.ownership: not owned by a public authority
properties.notes: There is a retail unit on-site which would require demolition before redevelopment could take place. It is understood that options for the future of the site have been considered. Not immediately available but the site could be a medium- to long-term option.

properties.ownership: not owned by a public authority
properties.notes: Site located within urban area, currently being occupied by an existing building although it is now vacant. Potential urban infill scheme, with demolition and clearance likely to be required, although there could be scope for a conversion scheme.

properties.ownership: owned by a public authority
properties.notes: Former Council offices within town centre location, including existing buildings and area of car parking. Largely vacant and out of use and surplus to requirements. Demolition and clearance of the existing buildings will be required prior to redevelopment. An above average density could be suitable given the central location.

properties.ownership: not owned by a public authority
properties.notes: Historically location of a small colliery, this land is to the eastern edge of a very small settlement, and is now part hardstanding, with an existing building also in situ. Clearance would be required prior to any redevelopment. A lower yield could well be appropriate given the rural location.

properties.site-address: Former Haulage Yard adjoining The Lamb, Ancroft
properties.ownership: not owned by a public authority
properties.notes: Site part occupied by an existing storage shed, which will require clearance, but it is understood that this could be available for redevelopment in the future. Whilst the highly rural setting is recognised the site may offer opportunity for a small-scale infill development in the longer-term.

properties.ownership: not owned by a public authority
properties.notes: Brownfield site in a predominantly residential area which is currently occupied by a car sales garage. This business is still operating but it is understood that the site has been earmarked for future redevelopment. Demolition and site clearance would be required prior to this progressing. An application for demolition of existing buildings and erection of 9 residential units has been refused (18/02671/FUL). However, this does not prevent a suitable scheme coming forward in the future following a revised proposal being deemed appropriate.

properties.site-address: Land known as Foggon's Yard, Rothbury
properties.ownership: not owned by a public authority
properties.notes: Area of vacant hardstanding within the settlement. Site would offer opportunity for a small-scale infill development. Understood to be available for redevelopment.

properties.ownership: not owned by a public authority
properties.notes: Area of land at Amble Harbour, currently part vacant and part occupied by car parking facilities. Site could offer the opportunity for an attractive location for a small-scale residential development. Not available in the immediate term and likely to represent a longer-term option for redevelopment. Any successful scheme would have to carefully consider the relationship with adjacent uses, particularly the business and operational needs of the harbour.

properties.site-address: Garages East Of 3-6 Greenwich Gardens and Land North Of 62 Langley Gardens, Haydon Bridge
properties.ownership: not owned by a public authority
properties.notes: Land is currently part occupied by garages and part vacant. Clearance will be required prior to any redevelopment occurring. An application for development of 6 affordable homes has now been permitted (17/04061/FUL). Development has not yet started but is forecast to be completed in the coming 5 years.

properties.site-address: Land south of James Street, Seahouses
properties.ownership: not owned by a public authority
properties.notes: Existing dwellings that have been earmarked for potential redevelopment following demolition and site clearance. A proposal for the construction of 9 affordable dwellings following demolition of 6 existing dwellings, was permitted in March 2019 (18/03787/FUL). This scheme covers two parcels of land (9502 and 9105) and is yet to commence given the recent approval. A previous application across three parcels of land (9095, 9096, 9503) for 15 affordable dwellings, after demolition of existing homes, was withdrawn July 2018 (18/00887/FUL). Capacity recorded against site 9503.

properties.site-address: Whytrig Community Middle School, Seaton Delaval
properties.ownership: owned by a public authority
properties.notes: Closed middle school site, now cleared, comprising footprint of former buildings and areas of hardstanding. Identified as an allocation in the draft Local Plan (submitted May 2019).

properties.ownership: not owned by a public authority
properties.notes: Brownfield land currently occupied by Seghill Social Club. Demolition and clearance would be required but the site will be available. A full application for demolition followed by redevelopment of the site for 8 homes is now consented (17/03368/FUL). Development is yet to start but is expected to be completed within 5 years.

properties.site-address: 7C Netherton Lane and land to the east and south east, Bedlington
properties.ownership: not owned by a public authority
properties.notes: Land that is part occupied but which also includes elements of open and vacant land. Clearance of the site would be required prior to redevelopment and so the site is not available in the short-term. However it is understood this is likely to change and an outline application for development of 16 dwellings is now pending consideration (18/02329/OUT). If permitted, the deliverability of the site will be reappraised.

properties.site-address: Land north of Bassington Avenue, Cramlington
properties.ownership: not owned by a public authority
properties.notes: Vacant site on an industrial estate in Cramlington and currently allocated as employment land. This is part of a wider site granted permission for mixed-use development and, whilst residential development has been completed on the eastern part of the site (6037), this section was permitted for employment uses. However, it is understood that future options for the site are being considered and that potential for residential development may exist. This will depend on future requirements for employment land in the locality.

properties.site-address: Artique at The Marine, Marina Arms, The Wynd
properties.ownership: not owned by a public authority
properties.notes: Café and associated car parking in Amble located within an established residential area. An application is currently being considered for the demolition of the existing business and redevelopment of the site for 7 homes (19/00730/FUL). If permitted, the deliverability of the site will be reappraised.

properties.ownership: not owned by a public authority
properties.notes: This land is occupied by a building containing bedsits but that has been identified for redevelopment. A proposal is currently awaiting determination for demolition of the existing building and replacement with a new care home facility for the elderly, which will provide 34 units (19/01223/FUL). If permitted, the deliverability of the site will be reappraised.

properties.ownership: not owned by a public authority
properties.notes: Town centre pub and adjoining land that has been proposed for redevelopment, providing flats through a conversion scheme. A planning application was approved in December 2018 for 6 units, comprising of change of use to 4 residential flats along with a further 2 new-build cottages to the rear of the site (18/01400/FUL). Development has yet to start but is anticipated to be completed in the next 5 years.

properties.ownership: not owned by a public authority
properties.notes: Brownfield site within Rothbury comprising an area of hardstanding and a small outbuilding. The site has been identified as a good opportunity to redevelop to provide new housing within the town. A planning application was approved in November 2018 for 5 new-build bungalows (18/01144/FUL). Whilst yet to commence, delivery is expected within 5 years.

properties.ownership: not owned by a public authority
properties.notes: Retail and commercial premises in Prudhoe town centre that could offer scope for residential use. This would be through conversion of the first floor to housing. Development was approved in February 2019 for a change of use to provide 6 apartments in February 2019 (18/04526/FUL). Given this was only recently granted consent, works have yet to start, but completion is anticipated within the next 5 years once underway.

properties.ownership: not owned by a public authority
properties.notes: Haulage yard and workshop at the edge of the settlement which has been identified as having potential to provide new housing. In November 2018, planning permission was granted for the redevelopment of the site to provide 5 dwellings (18/01897/FUL). The site is expected to be completed within 5 years but has yet to commence.
